Sentencas: Traditional solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) with Ni cermet anode are not stable operating in CH4 due to carbon deposition.
Titulo: Direct operation of methane fueled solid oxide fuel cells with Ni cermet anode via Sn modification

Sentencas: Here we report excellent long-term stability of the cell with Ni/SDC anode is achieved in 3% H2O humidified CH4 in a temperature range of 700-800 degrees C by addition of 1wt%Sn to the porous anode.
Titulo: Direct operation of methane fueled solid oxide fuel cells with Ni cermet anode via Sn modification

Sentencas: The addition of a small amount of Sn does not compromise the electrochemical performance of the cell in humidified H-2.
Titulo: Direct operation of methane fueled solid oxide fuel cells with Ni cermet anode via Sn modification

Sentencas: For the 1%Sn-Ni/SDC anode, the peak power density of the cell reaches 0.28 Wcm(-2) in 3% H2O humidified CH4 and the current density decreases only by 30% after the cell is operated under a constant voltage of 0.8 V in humidified CH4 for 230 h at 700 degrees C.
Titulo: Direct operation of methane fueled solid oxide fuel cells with Ni cermet anode via Sn modification

Sentencas: The Ni and Sn mappings of the tested cell indicate that Sn is enriched on the anode surface and Sn-Ni intermetallics form.
Titulo: Direct operation of methane fueled solid oxide fuel cells with Ni cermet anode via Sn modification

Sentencas: It is found that a critical process is essential to oxidize the impregnated SnCl2 into SnO2 at a temperature higher than 800 degrees C, hence metallic Sn can'be obtained and consequently it further forms highly catalytic activity Sn-Ni intermetallics in H-2.
Titulo: Direct operation of methane fueled solid oxide fuel cells with Ni cermet anode via Sn modification

Sentencas: These results demonstrate that the addition of 1wt%Sn can significantly enhance the coking tolerance of the Ni/SDC anode.
Titulo: Direct operation of methane fueled solid oxide fuel cells with Ni cermet anode via Sn modification
